website_summaries.verdict: A good refractometer made for home brewing that is both accurate and affordable.
pros: Capable of taking readings in both brix and specific gravity measurements
Eyepiece is clear and comfortable to use for short periods of time
cons: Refractometer requires a separate calculator or conversion chart to get the final readings

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool
customer_reviews.text: I use this when making had cider. Much easier than than using a hydrometer and far less wasteful of your cider since it only needs 2-3 drops. The instructions were ok but it took a while to feel comfortable when calibrating it. Same when reading the specific gravity/brix scale although using a brighter light source helps. Come with a nice case. Refractometer is very solid/sturdy but you need to handle with care since it is an optical device. I wish I had bought one a long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: hsparks

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.author: MR. TTop Contributor: Brewing

customer_reviews.title: A must-have addition to your brewing arsenal! Great deal as well.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this refractometer for only one batch of beer, but already can't imagine brewing without it. I was able to quickly and accurately assess the gravity of my wort at every step of the way, including monitoring the sparged wort every 5 minutes. Only a couple drops of wort are required for a clear result. The only thing I don't like is how easy the eyepiece turns, which can slightly throw off the focus over time. I highly recommend this product, especially at the price found on Amazon. Buy it already!
customer_reviews.author: Asdf1980

customer_reviews.title: Really Cool Gadget
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how easy this was. I got it for homebrewing gravity measurements, and compared the readings to the standard hydrometer/cylinder/math method; the results were either identical or within 0.001, with the refractometer tending to read slightly lower. For what I do, that's well worth this thing's ease of use. It only takes a couple of drops and there's your measurement. It's also very easy to calibrate, the directions are clear and easy to follow, and it comes in a decent case.

However, I see this lasting me since it's so sturdy, and I will be able to recalibrate some day.

customer_reviews.text: Bad refractometer. I had used it for two batches and hit my target gravitates but I then found out they were actually off. This refractometer is off by 10-20 points. Not reliable at all. Stuck with my old hydrometer instead, waste more beer but more reliable than this.
